sentences.text: 2016 FINANCIAL HIGHLIGHTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: t Record total revenue increased 3% to $6.8 billion and record operating revenue* increased 4% to $5.8 billion compared to 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earnings per share from continuing operations decreased 14% to $4.94 and comparable earnings per share* decreased 12% to $5.42.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: t Total revenue and operating revenue growth increased due to growth in the full service lease fleet (for the fifth consecutive year).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The growth in contractual revenue reflects continued progress on our strategy to convert private fleets to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: t Although our contractual business continued to grow, earnings were negatively impacted primarily due to a cyclical market downturn impacting our transactional business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: t Our stock price increased from $56.83 at year end 2015 to $74.44 at year end 2016; our total shareholder return was 39% for 2016 versus 38% for our custom peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: t Adjusted return on capital (ROC)* decreased 100 basis points from 5.8% to 4.8% due to lower net earnings impacted by lower used vehicle sales and rental results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Operating revenue, comparable earnings per share and ROC are non-GAAP financial measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a reconciliation of total revenue to operating revenue, GAAP EPS to comparable EPS and a reconciliation of the non-GAAP elements of our ROC calculation to the corresponding GAAP measures, as well as the reasons why management believes these measures are useful to shareholders, refer to the "Non-GAAP Financial Measures" section on pages 55-63 of our annual report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016.

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION HIGHLIGHTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strong Shareholder Support on Say on Pay
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: t 96% Say on Pay support at our 2016 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee believes that the vote indicates support for our program, including enhancements made in the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policies that Promote Significant and Long-Term Ownership and Sustainable Shareholder Value Creation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: t 86% of our CEO's target compensation is composed of "at risk" compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO compensation is a mix of base salary (14%), short-term incentives (20%) and long-term incentives (66%) which we believe provides compensation opportunities measured by a variety of time horizons to balance our near-term and long-term strategic goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: t A variety of distinct performance metrics are used in the short-term and long-term incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This portfolio approach to performance metrics encourages executives to focus on overall, sustainable Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: t Equity incentive programs and stock ownership guidelines are designed to align management and shareholder interests by providing vehicles for executive officers to accumulate and maintain an ownership position in the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017, the Compensation Committee increased ownership requirements from four to six times base salary for the CEO, and from two to three times base salary for all other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership requirements for the Board of Directors were also increased from five to six times such director's total annual cash retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: t In 2017, the Compensation Committee decided to replace performance-based cash awards with performance-based restricted stock rights for all future grants starting in 2017 in order to increase shareholder alignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Priority on Risk Management and Sound Compensation Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: t We cap the maximum payout of our annual cash incentive awards based on a percentage of our pre-tax earnings from continuing operations (EBT), and cap our performance-based restricted stock rights and performance-based cash awards under our long-term incentive program at 125% of target to limit the potential for excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017, the Compensation Committee decided to increase the cap on performance-based restricted stock rights to 150% of target to reflect predominant industry practice for grants commencing in 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: t We incorporate several risk mitigation policies into our compensation program, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s The Compensation Committees ability to use negative discretion to align appropriate payouts to Company and individual performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Anti-hedging and anti-pledging policies; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Written clawback policy for financial restatements resulting from executive misconduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: t In 2016, the Board amended and restated the Company's 2012 Equity and Incentive Compensation Plan (Equity Plan) to provide for double-trigger vesting of all future incentive grants upon a change of control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our cash severance and annual cash incentive awards are already subject to double-trigger vesting provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rigorous Goals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: t Goals are approved by our independent directors and take into account our historical performance, current strategic initiatives and the challenging macroeconomic environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, 2016 target operating revenue was $5.8 billion, an increase from our 2015 actual operating revenue of $5.6 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, the target comparable earnings per share for 2016 was $6.30, an increase
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: from the comparable EPS results in 2015 of $6.13.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the ROC target of 5.48% for 2016 was lower than 2015 actual ROC performance of 5.82% due to the expected macroeconomic challenges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INFORMATION ABOUT OUR ANNUAL MEETING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are receiving this proxy statement because you own shares of Ryder common stock that entitle you to vote at the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held on Friday, May 5, 2017 at 10:00 a.m., Eastern Daylight Time, at our corporate headquarters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors is soliciting proxies from shareholders who wish to vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By using a proxy, you can vote even if you do not attend the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement describes the matters on which you are being asked to vote and provides information on those matters so that you can make an informed decision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Annual Meeting, you will be asked to vote on the following five proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recommendation for each proposal is set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. To ratify the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as our independent registered certified public accounting firm for the 2017 fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you sign and return your proxy without making any selections, your shares will be voted FOR each of the director nominees, "FOR" Proposals 2 and 3, "EVERY YEAR" on Proposal 4 and "AGAINST" on Proposal 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If other matters properly come before the meeting, the proxy holders will have the authority to vote on those matters on your behalf at their discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the date of this proxy statement, we are not aware of any matters that will come before the meeting other than those disclosed in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (Proposal 1)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our By-Laws, directors are elected annually beginning in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before 2016, directors were elected for three-year terms, typically with one-third of the Board standing for election in any given year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The directors currently serving three-year terms will continue to serve the remainder of their terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thereafter, each director will be elected annually when his or her three-year term expires.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors up for election at the 2017 Annual Meeting will be nominated for one-year terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Robert J. Eck, L. Patrick Hassey, Michael F. Hilton, Tamara L. Lundgren, Abbie J. Smith and Hansel E. Tookes, II are currently serving terms that expire at the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the recommendation of the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee (Governance Committee), our Board has nominated Mr. Eck, Mr. Hassey, Mr. Hilton, Ms. Lundgren, Ms. Abbie Smith an Mr. Tookes, for re-election at the 2017 Annual Meeting for one-year terms that expire at the 2018 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John M. Berra, Robert A. Hagemann, Luis P. Nieto, Jr., E. Follin Smith and Robert E. Sanchez are currently serving terms that expire at the 2018 Annual Meeting.

sentences.text: Election of Directors (Proposal 1)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Criteria, Qualifications and Experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that each of our directors has the experience, skills, qualities and time to successfully perform his or her duties as a director and contribute to our Company's success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors were nominated because each individual possesses the highest standards of personal integrity and interpersonal and communication skills, is highly accomplished in his or her field, has an understanding of the interests and issues that are important to our shareholders and is able to dedicate sufficient time to fulfilling his or her obligations as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors, as a group, complement each other and each others respective experiences, skills and qualities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors make up a diverse body in terms of age, gender, tenure, ethnic background and professional experience but engender a cohesive body in terms of Board process, collaboration, mutual respect for differing perspectives and commitment to receiving input on all director viewpoints when evaluating critical issues and making important decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More information on Ryder's nomination process is set forth in the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee section under "Board Succession Process for Directors" on page 20.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Tenure and Board Refreshment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board composition and refreshment is a priority for Ryder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that it is esirable to maintain a mix of new, experienced and longer-tenured directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board does not believe it should expressly limit a irector's tenure, and values the increasing contribution of directors who, over time, have developed deeper insight into the company nd its operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, to encourage appropriate refreshment and continued qualification of our Board members, our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that at the time when each director is up for re-election, the continuation of such director on the Board s reviewed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Policies and Practices Related to Director Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a general policy that directors must retire immediately prior to the Annual Meeting closest to the date the director turns 72, which the Board has authority to waive in individual cases if the best interests of the Company would be served by such waiver.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limits on Other Directorships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure our directors have adequate time to serve on our Board, we permit service on no more than four other public company boards (or two other public company boards for our Chief Executive Officer (CEO)/Chair).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No director currently serves on more than three other company boards and our CEO serves on one other public company board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have determined that each director nominee and director continuing in office has the adequate time to serve on our Board, carry out his or her duties and provide valuable service to the Company in his or her role as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meeting Attendance Requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are expected to regularly attend Board and committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors who fail to attend at least 75% of Board and committee meetings for two consecutive years must submit a letter of resignation, which the Board will determine whether to accept, taking into account the recommendation of the Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our directors met the meeting attendance requirements in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resignation upon Change in Status.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also requires directors to submit a letter of resignation upon a substantial change in the nature of the director's employment or other significant responsibilities since the time of his or her election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board, upon review and recommendation by the Governance Committee, will determine whether the circumstances are consistent with the criteria for Board membership and whether it is appropriate for a director to continue service on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Impairment of Ability to Serve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors who experience any other change in circumstances that may impair their ability to effectively serve on the Board, or that could result in negative attention to the Company or director, are required to immediately notify the Company and may be asked by the Board to submit a letter of resignation.

sentences.text: CURRENT PRINCIPAL OCCUPATION:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Served as the Executive Vice President, Chief Financial Officer and Chief Administrative Officer of Constellation Energy Group, Inc., then the nation's largest competitive supplier of electricity to large commercial and industrial customers and the nation's largest wholesale power seller, until May 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Smith joined Constellation Energy Group as Senior Vice President, Chief Financial Officer in June 2001 and was appointed Chief Administrative Officer in December 2003.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DESCRIPTION OF BUSINESS EXPERIENCE:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before joining Constellation Energy Group, Ms. Smith was Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Armstrong Holdings, Inc., the global leader in hard-surface flooring and ceilings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Armstrong, Ms. Smith held various senior financial positions with General Motors, including Chief Financial Officer for General Motors Delphi Chassis Systems division.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director since: July 2005
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Age: 57
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A past director of Kraft Foods Group (until July 2015)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A past director of Discover Financial Services (until May 2014)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: QUALIFICATIONS:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board nominated Ms. Smith as a director based on her leadership experience and expertise in finance, human resources, risk management, legal and information technology, which the Board finds to be valuable skills that complement the other skills represented on our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Ms. Smith has leadership experience serving as Chief Financial Officer and Chief Administrative Officer of global public companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She also has experience as a director on other global public company boards, including serving on audit, governance and risk committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our policies and practices related to director service, in making a determination as to Ms. Smith's nomination, the Board considered Ms. Smith's past experience as a CFO and service on other company boards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Smith was renominated based on her qualifications listed above, her valuable, significant contributions to the Board and Company and her demonstrated willingness and ability to commit adequate time and attention to all Board matters.

sentences.text: BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is our policy that a substantial majority of the members of our Board and all of the members of our Audit Committee, Compensation Committee, Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee, and Finance Committee qualify as independent under the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) corporate governance listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assist it in making independence determinations, our Board has adopted director independence standards, which are included as part of our Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see Appendix A of this proxy statement for the full text of the director independence standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our director independence standards set forth certain transactions or relationships that the Board determined will not, by themselves, be deemed to create a material relationship for the purpose of determining director independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board will consider all relationships and transactions with our directors, even those that meet these standards, to determine whether the particular facts or circumstances of the relationship or transaction would impair the director's independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Independence Review
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In preparation for our 2017 Annual Meeting, the Board undertakes an annual review of director independence, which includes a review of each directors responses to questionnaires asking about any relationships with us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This review is performed in accordance with our Corporate Governance Guidelines and is designed to identify and evaluate any transactions or relationships between a director or any member of his or her immediate family and us or members of our senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the ordinary course of business, transactions may occur between us and entities with which some of our directors are or have been affiliated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with its evaluation of director independence, our Board identified and reviewed several transactions that occurred during 2016 between us and companies where our directors or family members of our directors serve as executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, Mr. Eck, Mr. Hilton and Ms. Lundgren serve as executives of companies that lease vehicles or receive other services from us, or provide services or products to us, such as maintenance equipment or parts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reviewed each of these commercial relationships and found that all transactions between us and the relevant companies were made in the ordinary course of business and negotiated at arms length.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, each of these commercial relationships was well below the threshold set forth in our director independence standards (i.e., one percent of such other companys consolidated gross revenues for such year or $1 million, whichever is greater).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, our Board determined that none of these commercial relationships impaired the independence of the relevant director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Board reviewed charitable donations and contributions made by the Company to tax-exempt organizations where our directors serve as a trustee or director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, Ms. Lundgren serves on the board of a tax-exempt organization to which the Company makes or has made contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reviewed this relationship and found that all contributions made by the Company were made in the ordinary course, at arms length and consistent with our policies and procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, this relationship was below the threshold set forth in our director independence standards (i.e., one percent of such organizations consolidated gross revenues for such year or $250,000, whichever is greater).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, our Board determined that this relationship does not impair Ms. Lundgren's independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its independence review and after considering the transactions described above, the Board determined that each of the following directors (which together constitute all members of the Board other than Mr. Sanchez) is independent: John M. Berra, Robert J. Eck, Robert A. Hagemann, L. Patrick Hassey, Michael F. Hilton, Tamara L. Lundgren, Luis P. Nieto, Jr., Abbie J. Smith, E. Follin Smith and Hansel E. Tookes, II.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Engagement and Communications with the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board and management are committed to engaging with our shareholders and obtaining their views and input on performance, governance, executive compensation and any other matters important to our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board-Driven Engagement and Board Reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance Committee oversees the shareholder engagement process and reviews and assesses shareholder input.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this process, the Committee regularly provides updates to the full Board on shareholder engagement efforts and feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Year-Round Engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryder conducts routine shareholder outreach, so that the Board and Company remain informed on the issues that our shareholders tell us matter most to them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually, we reach out to approximately our top 50% of shareholders (or more) to discuss Ryder's corporate governance and compensation profile and any other shareholder concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reach out to our top shareholders to gain feedback prior to making any material governance changes or when we are considering whether to support or enact provisions requested in a shareholder proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Engagement Participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board Chair and CEO, Chief Legal Officer and Corporate Secretary, and/or Vice President of Corporate Strategy and Investor Relations participate in meetings with shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When appropriate, other Board members, including our Lead Independent Director and Governance Committee Chair, participate in the meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For instance, in the past, our Lead Independent Director and Governance Committee Chair have participated in shareholder engagement meetings when we were considering material governance changes requested by shareholders, implementing shareholder feedback or when requested by certain shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Summary of Ryder's 2016 Shareholder Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s During the Summer and Fall of 2016, we sought feedback from shareholders holding over 50% of our shares, including our top 20 shareholders, on Ryder's governance and compensation profile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s We received substantive feedback from shareholders holding nearly 20% of our shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No significant concerns were noted by shareholders who provided us with feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders we heard from indicated
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s they were pleased with Ryder's governance changes and Board responsiveness over the last few years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s We also hosted our first Investor Day in 2016, during which our management team interacted directly with our shareholders regarding our management, performance and short- and long-term strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board of Directors

sentences.text: Transparency and Informed Governance Enhancements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance Committee and full Board regularly review our governance practices and policies with an eye toward continual improvement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to considering shareholder feedback obtained through our engagement process, our Board regularly reviews the voting results of our shareholder meetings, governance and proxy voting policies of our shareholders who publish their policies, other published materials reflecting shareholder views, governance practices of our peers and other companies similar in size to Ryder (such as Fortune 500 and S&P 500 companies), and current trends in corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actions Taken as a Direct Result of Our Shareholder Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Implemented a balanced proxy access right in 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Commenced annual director elections beginning in 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Adopted double-trigger vesting upon a change of control in our Equity Plan in 2016 (eliminating our single-trigger vesting provisions)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Lowered our general voting standard to a majority of votes cast
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Eliminated supermajority voting provisions regarding removal of directors, amendment of certain provisions of our Articles of Incorporation and By-Laws and approval of certain business combinations with interested shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Began disclosing our political contributions policy and annual direct corporate contributions to political candidates on our website
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Periodically update our corporate sustainability report
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Communications with the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders and other interested parties can communicate with our independent directors as a group through an external toll-free hotline number at 1-800-815-2830 (7 days a week/24 hours a day), through the Corporate Governance page in the Investors area of our website at http://investors.ryder.com, or by mailing their communication to Independent Directors, c/o Corporate Secretary, Ryder System, Inc., 11690 N.W. 105th Street, Miami, Florida 33178.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any communications received from interested parties in the manner described above will be collected and organized by our Corporate Secretary and will be periodically, but in any event prior to each regularly-scheduled Board meeting, reported and/or delivered to our independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Secretary will not forward spam, junk mail, mass mailings, service complaints or inquiries, job inquiries, surveys, business solicitations or advertisements, or patently offensive or otherwise inappropriate materials to the independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Correspondence relating to some of these matters, such as service issues, may be distributed internally for review and possible response.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The procedures for communicating with our independent directors as a group are available in the Investors area of our website at http://investors.ryder.com, on the Corporate Governance page.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Audit Committee has established procedures for the receipt, retention and treatment of complaints regarding questionable accounting, internal control, financial improprieties or auditing matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any of our employees or members of the general public may confidentially communicate concerns about any of these matters to any supervisor or manager, the Chief Legal Officer, the Vice President of Internal Audit or the Chief Compliance Officer, or on a confidential and/or anonymous basis by way of a third party toll- free hotline number (1-800-815-2830) and web-based portal (https://ryder.alertline.com), via e-mail at ethics@ryder.com, or to members of our Audit Committee at audit@ryder.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the reporting mechanisms are publicized in the Investors area of our website at http://investors.ryder.com, in our Principles of Business Conduct, through in person and on-line compliance training and location posters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon receipt of a complaint or concern, a determination will be made whether it pertains to accounting, internal control, financial improprieties or auditing matters and, if it does, it will be handled in accordance with the procedures established by the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A summary of all complaints, of whatever type, received through the reporting mechanisms are reported to the Audit Committee at each regularly-scheduled Audit Committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Matters requiring immediate attention are promptly forwarded to the Chair of the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board held six regular meetings and one special meeting in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the directors attended at least 75% of the aggregate number of meetings of the Board and committees on which the director served in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our independent directors meet in outside directors session without management present as part of each regularly-scheduled Board meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Lead Independent Director presides over these outside directors sessions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect our directors to attend our Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our directors attended the 2016 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryder combines the positions of CEO and Board Chair.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryder believes that the CEO, as a Company executive, is in the best position to fulfill the Chairs responsibilities, including those related to identifying emerging issues facing Ryder, communicating essential information to the Board about Ryders performance and strategies, and proposing agendas for the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryder believes that its Board leadership structure is enhanced by the independent leadership provided by our Lead Independent Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has developed the role of a strong Lead Independent Director to facilitate and strengthen the Boards independent oversight of Company performance, strategy and succession planning, and uphold effective governance standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryders Corporate Governance Guidelines establish that the Board members shall appoint a Lead Independent Director every five years, although the Board has discretion to deviate from this cycle when it is in the best interests of the Company to do so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our current Lead Independent Director is Hansel E. Tookes, II, who has served in the position since 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Independent Directors duties are listed in our Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lead Independent Director Duties and Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Presides at all meetings of the Board at which the Chair is not present, including outside directors sessions of the independent directors (which are held at every regular meeting)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Serves as the liaison between the CEO/Chair and the independent directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Serves as the liaison between the Board and management to ensure the Board obtains the materials and information it needs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Requests and previews information sent to the Board, as necessar
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Develops meeting agendas for the Board, in collaboration with the Chair and Chief Legal Officer, to ensure that topics requested by the independent directors are included
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Has authority to call meetings of the independent directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Is available for consultation and direct communication with shareholders to discuss concerns and expectations, upon request
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Engages with other independent directors to identify matters for discussion at outside directors session
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Oversees annual CEO evaluation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s In addition, our Lead Independent Director, who also serves as our Governance Committee Chair, oversees the Boards annual evaluation process and the search process for new director candidates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Committees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has four standing committees - Audit, Compensation, Corporate Governance and Nominating, and Finance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the committees are composed entirely of independent directors who meet in outside directors session without management present as part of each regularly-scheduled committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each committee evaluates its performance annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table below provides current membership and 2016 meeting information for each committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted written charters that set forth each committees responsibilities, and provide for periodic review of each charter and annual evaluation of each committees performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charters grant each committee the authority to obtain the advice and assistance of, and receive appropriate funding from us for, outside legal, accounting or other advisors as a committee deems necessary to fulfill its obligations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The specific powers and responsibilities of the committees are set forth in more detail in their charters, which are available in the Investors area of our website at http://investors.ryder.com, on the Corporate Governance page.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of each year, the committees review and approve agenda schedules for the following year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agenda schedules outline the various topics the committees will consider during the year to ensure they adequately fulfill their committee charter responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committees consider other topics during the year as needed to fulfill their responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Chief Legal Officer works closely with the Board Chair, Lead Independent Director and committee Chairs to ensure that information presented to the committees with respect to items discussed and/or approved is clear and comprehensive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Authority, Role of Management and Delegation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for reviewing and approving all components of our executive compensation program as well as the compensation program for our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New executive compensation plans and programs must be approved by the full Board based on recommendations made by the Compensation Committee.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, with input from the CEO, is responsible for setting the compensation of all other named executive officers.

sentences.text: Our independent directors, acting as a group, are responsible for setting CEO compensation based on recommendations from the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the terms of its charter, the Compensation Committee may delegate all or a portion of its responsibilities relating to retirement plans to the Company's Retirement Committee.

sentences.text: For additional discussion of the Compensation Committee's processes and procedures for the consideration and determination of executive compensation, please see the discussion under Compensation Setting Process in our Compensation Discussion and Analysis on page 34 of this proxy statement.

sentences.text: Board Succession Process for Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance Committee seeks to build and maintain an experienced, effective, well-rounded and diverse Board exemplifying sound judgment and integrity that operates collaboratively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Below is a summary of our process for identifying director candidates:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Identifying and recommending individuals for nomination, election or re-election to our Board is a principal responsibility of our Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee carries out this function through an ongoing, year-round process, which includes the annual evaluation of our Board and committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director candidate is evaluated by the Governance Committee based on his or her individual merits, taking into account our Company's needs and the composition of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee will seek to identify individuals who would qualify as independent under applicable NYSE listing standards and our director independence standards, and who are independent of any particular constituency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee may, based on the composition of the Board, seek individuals who have specialized skills or expertise, experience as a leader of another public company or major complex organization, or relevant industry experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also focuses on what skills are beneficial for service on each committee and for key Board positions, such as Lead Independent Director and committee chairs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually, the Committee reviews Board and committee composition and conducts a succession planning process to fill, rotate and refresh those positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In identifying individuals to nominate for election to our Board, the Governance Committee seeks candidates that:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: have a high level of personal integrity and exercise sound business judgment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: are highly accomplished, with superior credentials, recognition and/or strong senior leadership experience in their respective fields
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: have relevant expertise and experience that is valuable to the business of the Company and its long-term strategy, goals and initiatives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: have an understanding of, and concern for, the interests of our shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: have sufficient time to devote to fulfilling their obligations as directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Composition Matrix.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee uses a Board Composition Matrix to identify the current skills, experience, expertise and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: diversity on the Board, and ensure all desired traits are represented by the current Board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When identifying desired director candidate traits, the Committee seeks out areas that may become underrepresented as a result of Board turnover or where additional skills would enhance the Board's composition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews and updates the Matrix on an ongoing basis, with individual input from all directors, as needed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retention of Experienced Director Search Firms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, the Governance Committee identifies individuals for service on our Board through the Governance Committees retention of experienced director search firms that use their extensive resources and networks to find qualified individuals who meet the qualifications established by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee will also consider qualified candidates who are proposed by other members of the Board, our senior management and, to the extent submitted in accordance with the procedures described below, our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee will not consider a director candidate unless the candidate has expressed his or her willingness to serve on the Board if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee seeks qualified candidates who will assist in making the Board a diverse body variety.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryder believes that a diverse group of directors brings a broader range of experiences to the Board and generates a greater variety of innovative ideas and perspectives, and, therefore, is in a better position to make complex decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Ryder believes its shareholders appreciate a diverse Board, which is more reflective of the overall investment community and markets we and our customers serve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, 6 of 11 directors are women or minorities, in addition to being highly qualified to serve on our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders Recommending a Director Candidate to the Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a shareholder would like to recommend a directo candidate to the Governance Committee, he or she must deliver to the Governance Committee the same information and statement of willingness to serve described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the recommending shareholder must deliver to the Governance Committee a representation that the shareholder owns shares of our common stock and intends to continue holding those shares until the relevant Annual Meeting of Shareholders, as well as a representation regarding the shareholders direct and indirect relationship to the suggested candidate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This information should be delivered to us at:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 11690 N.W. 105th Street Miami, Florida 33178 Attention: Corporate Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This information must be delivered to the Governance Committee no earlier than 120 and no later than 90 days prior to the one-year anniversary of the date of the prior years Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any candidates properly recommended by a shareholder will be considered and evaluated in the same way as any other candidate submitted to the Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon receipt of this information, the Governance Committee will evaluate and discuss the candidates qualifications, skills and characteristics in light of the current composition of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee may request additional information from the recommending party or the candidate in order to complete its initial evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Governance Committee determines that the individual would be a suitable candidate to serve as one of our directors, the candidate will be asked to meet with members of the Governance Committee, members of the Board and/or members of senior management, including in each case, our CEO, to discuss the candidates qualifications and ability to serve on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the Governance Committees discussions and the results of these meetings, the Governance Committee will recommend nominees for election to the Board and the Board will nominate a slate of directors for election by our shareholders at our Annual Meeting (or, if filling a vacancy between Annual Meetings, the Board will elect a nominee to serve on the Board).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to our Corporate Governance Guidelines, each incumbent director nominee must agree to tender his or her resignation for consideration by the Board if the director fails to receive the required number of votes for re- election in accordance with the By-Laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders Nominating a Director Candidate Through Proxy Access (for Inclusion in the Company's Proxy Materials).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our By-Laws provide for proxy access for director nominations by shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A shareholder, or group of up to 25 shareholders, owning Ryder stock representing an aggregate of at least 3% of our outstanding shares continuously for at least three years, may nominate and include in Ryder's proxy materials director nominees constituting up to 20% of Ryder's Board or 2 directors, whichever is greater, provided that the shareholder(s) and nominee(s) satisfy the proxy access requirements set forth in our By-Laws, including Articles IV and V.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders Nominating a Director Candidate Without Using the Company's Proxy Materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a shareholder would like to nominate one or more directors for election at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders without involving the Governance Committee or following proxy access procedures, it must comply with all requirements set forth in our By-Laws, including Articles IV and V.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board and Committee Evaluation Process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee has oversight of the annual Board and committee evaluation process and uses feedback from the results of the evaluation to identify directors currently serving on the Board to be renominated for election at the expiration of their terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Governance Committee, led by the Lead Independent Director/Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chair, establishes the year's evaluation process, taking into account the Board's needs, how the evaluation was performed the previous year and Governance Committee input.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, evaluations alternate each year between open dialogue sessions in Board and committee outside directors sessions, where a list of potential topics is established and distributed

sentences.text: RISK MANAGMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board's Role in Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company understands that risk is present in its everyday business and organizational strategy and risk-taking is a necessary part of growing and operating a business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, the Company has implemented an enterprise risk management (ERM) program to provide management and the Board with a robust and holistic top-down view of key risks facing Ryder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ERM program is structured so that the Board is ultimately responsible for oversight of our ERM process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board executes its duty both directly and through its Audit, Compensation, Governance and Finance Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ERM is a Company-wide initiative that involves both the Board and Ryder's management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board/Committee Areas of Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strategic, financial, competitive and execution risk associated with the annual business operating plan and strategic plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Allocation of capital investments;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Major litigation and regulatory matters;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO and executive management succession planning; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business conditions and competitive landscape.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial matters (including financial reporting, accounting, public disclosure and internal controls), information technology, cybersecurity and ethics and compliance program; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee  CEO and executive compensation, equity and incentive-based compensation programs, performance management of officers and director compensation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation risk assessment (see "Compensation Risks" on page 43 of the Compensation Discussion and Analysis).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board effectiveness and organization, corporate governance, CEO evaluation process and director succession planning; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reputational risks relating to environmental, government relations, charitable contributions and safety matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Liquidity, pension plans (including investment performance, asset allocation and funded status), tax planning, currency and interest rate exposures and insurance strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our ERM program was developed and is run under the direction and supervision of our Chief Legal Officer and Chief Financial Officer with the assistance of external experts, and is managed day-to-day by our Chief Compliance Officer and Vice President of Internal Audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO and executive leadership team are responsible for risk identification, management and mitigation under our ERM processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that effective Board oversight of the ERM process is an essential element in the preservation and enhancement of shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All significant risks identified through our ERM program or ERM reports are communicated to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specific risks are discussed by the Board and/or one or more of the committees, based on areas of risk oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board's Risk Review and Assessment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Review significant risks and consider such risks when overseeing strategic and business decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discuss with management the effectiveness of our risk management processes in identifying, assessing and managing the organizations most significant enterprise-wide risk exposures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Receive an ERM report from the Chief Legal Officer, Chief Compliance Officer and Vice President of Internal Audit at least annually which (1) identifies the Company's risks, including detailed analysis of the likelihood of occurrence and potential impact of each risk, and (2) details the ERM program elements and process for risk identification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Receive written updates and presentations on specific risks and our ERM program at every regularly scheduled meeting, and discuss with management the most significant risks that are identified and managed by Ryder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Establish an annual schedule for the Board and committees to conduct individual, in depth reviews of the Company's key risks identified in the ERM report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s Receive an internal audit report from the Vice President of Internal Audit at least annually regarding internal audit's assessment of enterprise risks and audit activities to evaluate the controls and processes regarding such risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryder System, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement 23
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although Ryders ERM program is structured with formal processes, it remains flexible enough to adjust to changing economic, business and regulatory developments and is founded on clear lines of communication to the leadership team, the Board and its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Company periodically commissions an external assessment of its ERM program and its risk assessment processes to ensure they are in line with industry practices and are effectively identifying, monitoring and mitigating enterprise-wide risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RELATED PERSON TRANSACTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with our written Policies and Procedures Relating to Related Person Transactions adopted by the Board, all related person transactions are subject to review, approval or ratification by the Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Policies and Procedures are in addition to, not in lieu of, the requirements relating to conflicts of interest in our Principles of Business Conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Copies of both policies are available in the Investors area of our website at http://investors.ryder.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the Policies and Procedures, and consistent with Item 404 of Regulation S-K, a related person transaction is:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any transaction in which we or a subsidiary of ours is a participant, the amount involved exceeds $120,000 and a related person has a direct or indirect material interest; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any material amendment to an existing related person transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related persons are our executive officers, directors, nominees for director, any person who is known to be the beneficial owner of more than 5% of any class of our voting securities and any immediate family member of any of the foregoing persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Principles of Business Conduct require that directors and executive officers report any actual or potential conflicts of interest, including potential related person transactions, to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each director and executive officer completes and signs a questionnaire annually to confirm there are no material relationships or related person transactions between such individuals and the Company other than those previously disclosed to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This ensures that all material relationships and related person transactions are identified, reviewed and disclosed in accordance with applicable policies, procedures and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this information, we review the Company's own records and make follow-up inquiries as may be necessary to identify potentially reportable transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A report summarizing such transactions and including a reasonable level of detail is then provided to the Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee is responsible for reviewing and determining whether to approve related person transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering whether to approve a related person transaction, the Governance Committee considers the following factors, to the extent relevant:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether the terms of the related person transaction are fair to us and on the same basis as would apply if the transaction did not involve a related person;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether there are business reasons for us to enter into the related person transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether the related person transaction would impair the independence of an outside director; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether the related person transaction would present an improper conflict of interest for any of our directors or executive officers, taking into account the size of the transaction, the overall financial position of the director, executive officer or related person, the direct or indirect nature of the directors, executive officers or related persons interest in the transaction and the ongoing nature of any proposed relationship, and any other factors the Governance Committee deems relevant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any member of the Governance Committee who has an interest in the related person transaction must abstain from voting on the approval of the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although such member would normally be excused from any discussions relating to the transaction, the Governance Committee Chair has the authority to request that such member participate in some or all of the Committee's discussions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Typically, participation would only be requested if the other Committee members have questions about the interested member's involvement in the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were no related person transactions during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RATIFICATION OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (Proposal 2)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the independent registered certified public accounting firm retained to audit our consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has selected and appointed PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP for the year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP has audited our consolidated financial statements continuously since 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In executing its responsibilities set forth in its charter, the Audit Committee engages in a thorough annual evaluation of the independent registered certified public accounting firm's qualifications, performance and independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before the Audit Committee completes its evaluation, management conducts its own evaluation and provides the results of its evaluation to the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following completion of the Audit Committee's evaluation, performance feedback is provided to the independent registered certified public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is also responsible for approving the services and audit fees associated with the retention of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2016, the Audit Committee rotated the Company's lead engagement partner from Pricewaterhouse Coopers LLP, pursuant to the rotation requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and its Chair were directly involved in the selection of the new lead engagement partner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and Board believe that the continued retention of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP to serve as our independent registered certified public accounting firm is in the best interests of Ryder and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In selecting Pricewaterhouse Coopers LLP to serve as our independent registered certified public accounting firm for 2017, the Audit Committee considered a number of factors, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the quality of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP's work product and performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the professional qualifications of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, the lead engagement partner and other members of the audi team;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP's knowledge and experience with the Company's business operations and industry;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the results of the PCAOB review of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP;`
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP's independence program and controls for maintaining independence;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the appropriateness of Pricewaterhouse Coopers LLP's audit fees; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the results of the Audit Committee's and management's annual evaluation of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP's qualifications, performance and independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although shareholder ratification of the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP is not required, the Board believes that submitting the appointment to shareholders for ratification is a matter of good corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee will consider the outcome of this vote in future deliberations regarding the appointment of our independent registered certified public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP will be present at the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders to respond to appropriate questions and to make a statement if they desire to do so.

sentences.text: Audit Fees primarily represent amounts for services related to the audit of our consolidated financial statements and internal control over financial reporting, a review of financial statements included in our Forms 10-Q (or other periodic reports or documents filed with the SEC), statutory or financial audits for our subsidiaries or affiliates, and consultations relating to financial accounting or reporting standards.

sentences.text: Audit-Related Fees represent amounts for assurance and related services that are reasonably related to the performance of the audit or review of our financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These services include audits of employee benefit plans, consultations concerning matters relating to Section 404 of Sarbanes-Oxley and due diligence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Fees represent amounts for U.S. and international tax compliance services (including review of our federal, state, local and international tax returns), tax advice and tax planning, in accordance with our approval policies described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All services rendered by our independent registered certified public accounting firm are either specifically approved (including the annual financial statements audit) or are pre-approved by the Audit Committee, in each instance in accordance with our Approval Policy for Independent Auditor Services (Approval Policy), and are monitored both as to spending level and work content by the Audit Committee to maintain the appropriate objectivity and independence of the independent registered certified public accounting firms core service, which is the audit of our consolidated financial statements and internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Approval Policy, the terms and fees of annual audit services and any changes thereto, must be approved by the Audit Committee.

sentences.text: AUDIT COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is comprised of five outside directors, all of whom are independent under the rules of the NYSE, our director independence standards and applicable rules of the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee operates under a written charter that specifies the Committees responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The full text of the Committees charter is available in the Investors area of our website at http://investors.ryder.com, on the Corporate Governance page.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee members are not auditors and their functions are not intended to duplicate or to certify the activities of management and the independent registered certified public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee oversees Ryders financial reporting process on behalf of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryders management has the responsibility for preparing the consolidated financial statements, for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting and for assessing the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryders independent registered certified public accounting firm is responsible for performing an integrated audit of Ryders annual consolidated financial statements and internal control over financial reporting as of the end of the year in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) and expressing opinions on (1) whether the financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position and results of operations and cash flows of Ryder in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States and (2) whether Ryder maintained effective internal control over financial reporting based on criteria established in Internal Control - Integrated Framework (2013) issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fulfilling its oversight responsibilities, the Committee reviewed and discussed the audited consolidated financial statements in the annual report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016, and managements assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting with Company management, including a discussion of the quality of the accounting principles, the reasonableness of significant judgments and the clarity of disclosures in the financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviewed with the independent registered certified public accounting firm its judgments as to the quality of Ryders accounting principles and such other matters as are required to be discussed with the Committee by Auditing Standard No. 16, Communications with Audit Committees, adopted by the PCAOB, as amended and the rules of the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee has discussed the independent registered certified public accounting firms independence from Company management and Ryder with the firm, reviewed the written disclosures and letter from the independent registered certified public accounting firm required by applicable requirements of the PCAOB regarding the independent registered certified public accounting firms communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence, and considered the compatibility of non-audit services with the independent registered certified public accounting firms independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee discussed with Ryders internal auditor and representatives of the independent registered certified public accounting firm the overall scope and plans for their respective audits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee met with the internal auditor and representatives of the independent registered certified public accounting firm, with and without management present, to discuss the results of their audits; their evaluations of Ryders internal control, including internal control over financial reporting; and the overall quality of Ryders financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reliance on the reviews and discussions referred to above, the Committee recommended to the Board, and the Board has approved, hat the audited consolidated financial statements and managements assessment of the effectiveness of Ryders internal control over financial reporting be included in the annual report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016, filed by Ryder with the SEC The Committee has also approved, subject to shareholder ratification, the selection of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as Ryders ndependent registered certified public accounting firm for the 2017 fiscal year.

sentences.text: This executive summary provides an overview of 2016 Company performance, the alignment between our pay and our performance, shareholder outreach efforts and Say on Pay feedback, key compensation actions taken in 2016 and 2017 and our executive compensation governance practices.

sentences.text: Pay for Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At-Risk Pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our compensation goals and philosophy, our executives' direct compensation package is comprised of base salary, an annual cash incentive award, and a long-term performance-based equity and cash incentive award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following char illustrates the Company's commitment to pay for performance and shareholder alignment as it shows that for 2016: (1) 86% of Mr. Sanchez's target total direct compensation and 75% of the other NEOs' target total direct compensation was in the form of at-risk incentive compensation opportunities, the vesting and value of which are tied to achievement of performance goals or the Company's share price; and (2) 66% of Mr. Sanchez's pay and 53% of pay for the other NEOs was in the form of long-term equity and incentive compensation, vesting over three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we cap the maximum payout of our annual cash incentive awards at 200% of target and cap our performance-based restricted stock rights and performance-based cash awards at 125% of target to limit the potential for excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The percentages in the chart below were determined using: (1) actual salaries as reported in the Summary Compensation Table; (2) target payout opportunities under the annual cash incentive awards; and (3) target long-term incentive program (LTIP) opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described under "Annual Cash Incentive Award Targets Established" beginning on page 37, in 2016, annual cash incentive awards were earned primarily based on Ryder's performance with respect to comparable earnings per share from continuing operations (comparable EPS) and operating revenue and are subject to an aggregate funding mechanism based on EBT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee set performance targets for each performance metric at challenging levels despite a difficult macroeconomic environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, the target comparable EPS for 2016 was $6.30, an increase from 2015 actual results of $6.13.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, for 2016, the target operating revenue was $5.8 billion, an increase from 2015 actual operating revenue results of $5.6 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our actual 2016 performance results were below our 2016 targets, with comparable EPS at $5.42 (86.0% of the target performance level resulting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in a payout of 34.0% for the EPS metric) and operating revenue at $5.8 billion (99.5% of the target performance level resulting in a payout of 96.7% for the operating revenue metric).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviewed each NEO's individual performance and determined to grant 2016 annual cash incentive awards based on the Company-wide performance measures for each of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual payout amounts are set forth under Actual 2016 Annual Cash

sentences.text: Incentive Awards on page 38.

sentences.text: This demonstrates our commitment to establishing challenging targets and ensuring alignment between our executive pay and Company performance.
