sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As further described under Long-Term Incentive Program (LTIP) beginning on page 38, 2016 long-term incentive awards were granted in the form of options (40%), performance-based restricted stock rights (PBRSRs, 40%) and performance-based cash awards (PBCAs, 20%).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based awards may be earned from 0% to 125%, with half of each award based on total shareholder return (TSR) relative to a custom peer group and half based on adjusted return on capital (ROC).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in greater detail below, performance-based awards are earned over performance cycles of different durations, and all our long-term incentive awards vest after three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016 performance cycle: (1) Ryder's TSR ranked 11th compared to the custom peer group of the 27 companies (including Ryder), accruing a payout of 115%; and (2) Ryder's ROC was 4.82% (against a target of 5.48%) accruing a payout of 55.0%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The accruals will vest in February of 2019, after performance results for the 2017 and 2018 performance cycles are determined and approved by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Outreach - Say on Pay Feedback
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 Annual Meeting, 96% of shareholders approved our Say on Pay proposal, indicative of strong approval and support of our efforts to offer a competitive executive compensation program that delivers shareholder value over both the short- and long-term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even with these high levels of support, the Company and Board strongly believe in the importance of obtaining shareholder feedback and we have continued our ongoing shareholder outreach program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in more detail in the "Shareholder Engagement" section beginning on page 14, in the Summer and Fall of 2016, we reached out to our largest shareholders (constituting over 50% of our outstanding shares) to request feedback on both our governance and compensation structure and profile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overall, we received positive feedback, including feedback regarding our compensation programs and decisions, particularly with respect to the recent changes to our Amended and Restated 2012 Equity and Incentive Compensation Plan (Equity Plan) implementing "double-trigger" vesting in the event of a change of control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the strong Say on Pay vote results and positive feedback from our shareholders, we did not seek to make any significant changes to our overall executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Committee undertook refinements consistent with its ongoing efforts to ensure that our compensation programs are optimally designed, taking into account how to best ensure alignment between our compensation and shareholder values, respond to changing market practices and retain effective leaders who have a significant understanding of our business, particularly during a volatile economic environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016-2017 Key Compensation Actions and Decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n 2016 and 2017, the Committee continued to evaluate our executive compensation levels including how they compare to peer companies, and made necessary adjustments to ensure the design, structure and payouts of our executive compensation programs support our compensation philosophy and objectives and are consistent with shareholder expectations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highlighted below are the key actions taken by the Committee in 2016 and 2017 relating to executive compensation, all of which reflect the Company's commitment o aligning pay and performance:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: tMoved from "single-trigger" to "double-trigger" vesting in our Equity Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board amended, and our shareholders approved, changes to our Equity Plan to provide for double-trigger vesting upon a change of control for all future equity and incentive grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: tStrengthened annual performance targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, despite a challenging macroeconomic environment, the -Committee adjusted the targets for the 2016 annual cash incentive awards to generally require growth levels as high or higher than growth levels required in 2015 to achieve similar payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: tIncreased use of long-term equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017, the Committee decided to replace performance-based cash awards (PBCAs) with performance-based restricted stock (PBRSRs) for all grants starting in 2017 to further increase shareholder alignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: tIncreased stock ownership requirements for CEO, NEOs and the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017, the Board increased the stock ownership requirements from four times base salary to six times base salary for the CEO, from two times base salary to three times base salary for NEOs and from five times total annual cash retainer to six times such retainer for the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Setting Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for making determinations about our executive compensation programs, practices and levels.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee's independent compensation consultant along with management assist the Committee in making these determinations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Below is an explanation of: (1) the key roles and responsibilities of each group in setting executive compensation; (2) the executive evaluation process; (3) how competitive market data is integrated into the decision-making process; and (4) how shareholder feedback is evaluated.

sentences.text: Role of the Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for reviewing and approving, or recommending that the Board approve, all components of our executive compensation program as well as the compensation program for our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New executive compensation plans and programs must be approved by the full Board based on recommendations made by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and recommends the compensation of our CEO, and our independent directors, acting as a group, approve the amounts to be awarded to him.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After considering the assessment and recommendation of each NEO by the CEO, the Compensation Committee determines and approves the compensation of all other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Independent Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has retained Frederic W. Cook & Co., Inc. (Cook) as its independent consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cook reports directly to the Compensation Committee and provides advice about our compensation program and design, including views on current compensation trends and best practices and how our executive and director compensation program and practices competitively compare to our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cook also works with the Compensation Committee on a regular basis to provide recommendations and insights on how to make our executive compensation plans, practices and structure more effective and aligned with the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, Cook supported the Compensation Committee in evaluating enterprise and related risk associated with our executive compensation components and plans as discussed under Compensation Risks on page 43.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cook also provided advice to the Compensation Committee regarding director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A consultant from Cook attended a majority of the Compensation Committee meetings in person or by telephone in 2016, including participation in independent director session with no management present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee undertakes an annual review of whether Cook's work as a compensation consultant has raised any conflict of interest, taking into consideration the following factors: (1) the provision of other services to the Company by Cook; (2) the amount of fees from the Company paid to Cook as a percentage of Cook's total revenue; (3) Cook's policies and procedures that are designed to prevent conflicts of interest; (4) any business or personal relationship of Cooks compensation advisers with an executive officer of the Company or any member of the Compensation Committee; and (5) any stock of the Company owned by Cooks compensation advisers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Considering this information, the Compensation Committee confirmed that Cook does no other work for the Company and determined that Cook is independent and that its work for Ryder has not raised any conflict of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of Benchmarking
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee compares our executive compensation program to that of our peers to help analyze our executive compensation structure, determine the levels of compensation for our executives and review our program's effectiveness in attracting and retaining talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating each element of our executive compensation program, the Compensation Committee uses benchmark comparisons to peer groups and, particularly when appropriate peer group data is unavailable, with general industry survey data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does not design our executive compensation programs to fit within a specific percentile of the executive compensation programs of other companies comprising any particular peer group or survey.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does consider the median compensation of similar executives at the peer companies, both for each compensation component and the total compensation package, as a reference in making compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In assembling the comparative peer groups, the Compensation Committee is mindful that there are no public companies that provide the same mix of services as Ryder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, comparable compensation data is limited and less relevant for Ryder than it is for other companies in industries where there are more directly relevant and comparable peer groups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with its review of competitive market data, Cook utilized one peer group (Industry Peer Group) against which it analyzed each NEO's compensation.

sentences.text: Management and the Compensation Committee believe that utilizing data from this Industry Peer Group provides a useful basis of comparison for NEO compensation, as we compete with many of these companies for executive talent.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and carefully considers specific feedback received from shareholders, including the results of our Say on Pay votes.

sentences.text: Since 2011, Ryder has held a Say on Pay vote annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee believes that the results of our most recent Say on Pay vote (96% support) indicate our shareholders support of our compensation philosophy and the structure of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No significant concerns were noted by shareholders who provided us with feedback.

sentences.text: Shareholders we heard from indicated they were pleased with Ryder's governance changes and Board responsiveness over the last few years.

sentences.text: 2016 Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers do not have employment agreements which gives the Compensation Committee flexibility to change the components of our executive compensation program in order to remain market competitive, address economic conditions and ensure proper alignment with shareholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not have a formal policy relating to the allocation of total compensation among the various components.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, both management and the Compensation Committee believe that the more senior the position an executive holds, the more influence he or she has over our operating, financial and strategic performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, a greater amount of NEO compensation should be at-risk based on Ryder's performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the vast majority of target compensation that our NEOs are eligible to receive is dependent upon the achievement of short- and long-term performance objectives and/or appreciation in the value of Ryder stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to these incentive opportunities, our compensation program provides all executive officers, including our NEOs, a proportionately lesser amount of fixed elements, such as base salary and benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide competitive severance and change of control arrangements to ensure that the executive will act in the best interests of the shareholders rather than avoiding a transaction which could result in termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The actual compensation mix and value for each NEO may vary based on job responsibilities, market competition for the position, an individual's experience, past performance and contributions, compensation history, tenure, long-term potential, succession planning and strategic needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart below illustrates the principal elements and design of Ryder's executive compensation program in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all grants starting in 2017, PBCAs will be replaced with PBRSRs to further emphasize shareholder alignment, increasing the percentage of long- term incentive granted in the form of PBRSRs from 40% to 60%.

sentences.text: Our executive annual cash incentive awards are designed to balance payment for Company performance with recognition of individual performance, both positive and negative.

sentences.text: For 2016, the target payout opportunity remained unchanged for each of our NEOs at 150% of base salary for Mr. Sanchez, 100% of base salary for Mr. Cooke and Mr. Diez, and 80% of base salary for Mr. Garcia and Mr. Fatovic.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also sets Company performance targets for the awards.

sentences.text: Given the Company's continued focus on earnings and revenue growth in 2016, the Compensation Committee continued to use comparable EPS and operating revenue (weighted 60% and 40%, respectively) as the 2016 financial performance metrics for all incentive-eligible employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that these two metrics, taken together, measure our success in meeting our strategic objective of growing our revenue in a way that creates solid earnings leverage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, the Compensation Committee has discretion to adjust reported results for these metrics to ensure that they properly reflect the performance of our core business and are not impacted, positively or negatively, by certain items, including non-recurring or non-operational items.

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive Program (LTIP)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our LTIP is designed to align the interests of our NEOs with those of our shareholders by directly linking NEO pay with sustained Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers a variety of factors in establishing the LTIP target for an individual, including overall compensation relative to peers and market benchmarks; the NEOs role, responsibilities and performance; the NEOs long-term potential; retention risk; and the value of the NEOs outstanding equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once LTIP target values are set, the LTIP awards are granted in the form of stock options (40%), PBRSRs (40%) and PBCAs (20%).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 LTIP target values for each of our NEOs, and the amount of stock options, PBRSRs and PBCAs in which 2016 LTIP awards were granted, are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: *Stock options were issued at the closing price of our common stock as reported by the NYSE on February 10, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options under the LTIP vest in three equal annual installments and expire ten years from the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price is set as the closing price of our common stock on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in further detail below, PBRSRs and PBCAs vest at the end of a three-year performance period and are earned from 0% to 125% over performance cycles of different durations, with 50% of each award based on Ryders TSR relative to the TSR of a custom peer group and 50% based on Ryder's annual ROC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes using multiple metrics provides a more complete picture of Company performance and ensures management is focused on overall Company performance and not just performance in one area.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use a mixture of performance cycles in the LTIP to balance the interests of our shareholders over different time horizons and encourage appropriate risk-taking by our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The length of our performance periods reflects the cyclical nature of the transportation industry which is highly sensitive to supply and demand and macroeconomic conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that relying exclusively on three-year performance periods would negatively affect our ability to set goals that are appropriately rigorous given the economic environment in which we operate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee believes using multiple performance cycles incorporates and rewards short-, mid- and long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also align the long-term interests of our NEOs with those of our shareholders by granting a significant portion of our total compensation in equity, requiring our NEOs to meet robust stock ownership requirements and requiring a three-year vesting period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: t  Relative TSR is determined based on Ryders total shareholder return (TSR) relative to the TSR of a custom peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSR is calculated for Ryder and each peer company based on the average percentage change in the relevant stock price from the last ten trading days prior to the beginning of the relevant performance cycle to the last ten trading days prior to the end of the relevant performance cycle, assuming reinvestment of dividends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companies are then sorted by TSR performance, and Ryders relative TSR performance is measured based on Ryders ranking within the custom peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The custom peer group consists of companies in Ryders Industry Peer Group (as listed on page 35) plus additional companies that are subject to similar market conditions and economic recovery cycles as Ryder for a total of 27 companies (including Ryder).

sentences.text: The overall three-year performance period is segmented into three performance cycles of one, two and three years.

sentences.text: PBRSRs and PBCAs are earned based on performance in each performance cycle as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s 1/3 are earned based on performance results for Year 1 of the performance period (for 2016 LTIP awards, January 2016 through December 2016);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s 1/3 are earned based on performance results for Years 1 and 2 of the performance period (for 2016 LTIP awards, January 2016 through December 2017); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s 1/3 are earned based on performance results for Years 1, 2 and 3 of the performance period (for 2016 LTIP awards, January 2016 through December 2018).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: r the 2016 performance cycle, we applied the following three performance levels:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s   a threshold level, at which 30% of the award for the TSR performance metric will be earned if Ryder's TSR ranks twenty- first among the 27 companies in our custom peer group;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s   a target level, at which 100% of the award for the TSR performance metric will be earned if Ryder's TSR ranks fourteenth among the 27 companies in our custom peer group; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s   a maximum level, at which 125% of the award for the TSR performance metric will be earned if Ryder's TSR ranks in the top nine among the 27 companies in our custom peer group.

sentences.text: The adjustments represent the comparable items excluded from our comparable earnings measures (including non-operating pension costs and other significant items not representative of our business operations), as applicable, from the calculation of net earnings and average shareholder's equity (a component of average total capital).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use ROC as an internal measure of how effectively we use the capital invested (borrowed or owned) in our operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that using ROC as one of our LTIP performance metrics ensures that management maintains appropriate focus on capital efficiency across all of the Company's business segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The overall three-year performance period is segmented into three, one-year performance cycles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PBRSRs and PBCAs are earned based on performance in each performance cycle as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s 1/3 are earned based on performance results for Year 1 of the performance period (for 2016 LTIP awards, January2016 through December 2016);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s 1/3 are earned based on performance results for Year 2 of the performance period (for 2016 LTIP awards, January 2017 through December 2017); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s 1/3 are earned based on performance results for Year 3 of the performance period (for 2016 LTIP awards, January 2018 through December 2018).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Compensation Committee sets annual performance targets against which our ROC performance during the applicable performance cycle will be measured.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that setting the ROC target on an annual basis ensures that the most current capital market conditions will be reflected in establishing the target return shareholders expect each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee seeks to set performance targets that are attainable but challenging, taking into account the economic conditions in the markets we service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ROC target for 2016 was lower than 2015 actual ROC performance due to the expected macroeconomic challenges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our other performance targets in our 2016 NEO compensation program were set at or above 2015 actual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee establishes a threshold level at which 25% of the awards will be earned, a target level at which 100% of the awards will be earned and a maximum level at which 125% of the awards will be earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017, the Compensation Committee increased the maximum level at which awards will be earned from 125% to 150% for awards granted in 2017 and thereafter to better align with a predominant industry practice and will require a proportionate increase in performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: results to achieve the higher maximum level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards are earned proportionately between threshold and target performance levels and between target and maximum performance levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement and Welfare Benefits and Prerequisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains a qualified pension plan and a pension benefit restoration plan (pension restoration plan) in which any NEO that had joined the Company prior to January 1, 2007 was able to participate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These plans were frozen for all participants as of December 31, 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All NEOs are eligible to participate in the Company-wide 401(k) savings plan and deferred compensation plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The retirement and deferred compensation plans are described under the headings Pension Benefits and 2016 Nonqualified Deferred Compensation beginning on page 48 of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Health and Welfare Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, our NEOs were eligible to participate in the following standard welfare benefit plans: medical, dental and prescription coverage, Company-paid short- and long-term disability insurance, and paid vacation and holidays.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the NEOs received the following additional welfare benefits which are not available to all salaried employees: executive term life insurance coverage equal to three times the executives current base salary (limited to an aggregate of $3 million in life insurance coverage under the policy) in lieu of the standard Company-paid term life insurance and individual supplemental long-term disability insurance which provides up to approximately $20,000 per month (subject to age, earnings, health and state of residence limitations) in additional coverage over the $8,000 per month maximum provided under our group long-term disability plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that these additional benefits are consistent with benefits provided to other similarly-situated executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide a limited number of perquisites to our NEOs that we believe are related to the performance of their responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually, the Compensation Committee reviews the types and aggregate values of Ryders perquisite program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, in 2016, each NEO received the following perquisites:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: $9,600 per year as an annual car allowance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: $6,800 per year ($11,800 for our CEO) which is intended (but not required) to be used to pay for community, business or social activities that may be related to the performance of the executives duties, but which are not otherwise eligible for reimbursement as direct business expenses;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: up to $15,000 per year for financial planning and tax preparation services; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: up to $5,000 per year for the installation of a new or upgraded security system in the executives home and any related monthly monitoring fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All perquisites are fully taxable to the NEOs and are not subject to any tax gross-ups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance and Change of Control Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our NEOs are currently eligible for certain severance benefits under individual severance agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These arrangements are described in more detail under the heading Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change of Control on page 50 of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance arrangements are intended to ensure that NEOs will act in the best interests of the shareholders rather than avoiding transactions that could result in termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These arrangements are also designed to prevent our NEOs from seeking employment with our competitors after termination or soliciting our employees or customers during the restricted period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The change of control arrangements are designed to preserve productivity, avoid disruption and prevent attrition during a period when we are, or are rumored to be, involved in a change of control transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Granting Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has a written Policy on Equity Granting Practices, which provides that grants of equity awards must be approved by the Compensation Committee (or in the case of the CEO, the independent directors acting as a group) at a Board or Compensation Committee meeting and not by written consent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of off-cycle grants to new hires and existing employees (other than executive officers and other direct reports to our CEO), equity grants may be approved by the Chair of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant date of any equity award shall generally be on or after the date of the Board or Compensation Committee meeting at which the award was approved, provided that the grant date for a new hire will be the later of: (1) the date the award was approved by the Board, Compensation Committee or Compensation Committee Chair, as applicable; or (2) the date on which the new hire commences employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not time our equity award grants relative to the release of material non-public information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy allows the Compensation Committee to designate a grant date for time-based restricted stock rights that is after the Compensation Committee approval date in order to prevent the rights from vesting at a time when the executive is prevented from trading stock under Ryder's Insider Trading Policy, thereby avoiding potential negative tax implications to the executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEO Stock Ownership Requirements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage significant stock ownership by our NEOs to align the interests of our leadership team with those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We established stock ownership guidelines that require each NEO to own Ryder equity at least equal in value to a multiple of such NEOs salary within five years of appointment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017, the Committee increased the stock ownership requirements for the CEO from four times base salary to six time base salary and, for our NEOs, from two times base salary to three times base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO     6x
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other named executive officers    3x
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, each NEO meets these stock ownership requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibitions on Hedging and Pledging
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryder considers it improper and inappropriate for any Board member, officer or other employee of the Company to engage in short- term or speculative transactions in the Company's securities or from engaging in hedging transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, directors and executives are prohibited from holding the Company's securities in a margin account or otherwise pledging the Company's securities as collateral for a loan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Implications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deductibility of Executive Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, precludes public companies from taking a federal income tax deduction for compensation in excess of $1 million paid to individual NEOs unless certain specific and detailed criteria are met, including the requirement that compensation over $1 million be performance based and under a plan approved by our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its review of our executive compensation arrangements, the Compensation Committee is cognizant of the tax implications of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance awards granted under our compensation program are intended to constitute "performance based"
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Compensation Committee believes that preserving its flexibility in awarding compensation is in the Company's best interests and that of our shareholders and may determine, in light of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All annual cash incentive awards, stock options, PBRSRs and PBCAs granted in 2016 were intended to meet the performance based exception for deductibility under Section 162(m).

sentences.text: Compensation Risks
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cook was engaged by the Compensation Committee to assist with the assessment of risk arising from the Companys compensation programs and policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The assessment covered each material element of executive and non-executive employee compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on Cook's assessment, the Company concluded that these policies and practices do not create risk that is reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on Ryder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More specifically, this conclusion was based on the following considerations:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mitigating Policies/Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay Mix Compensation mix of base salary, short-term and long-term incentives provides compensation opportunities measured by a variety of time horizons to balance our near-term and long-term strategic goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Metrics A variety of distinct performance metrics are used in both the short-term and long-term incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This portfolio approach to performance metrics encourages focus on sustained and holistic overall company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Goals Goals are approved by our independent directors and take into account our historical performance, current strategic initiatives and the expected macroeconomic environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, short-term and long-term incentive compensation programs are designed with payout opportunities and leverage that support our pay for performance philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Incentives Equity incentive programs and stock ownership guidelines are designed to align management and shareholder interests by providing vehicles for executive officers to accumulate and maintain ownership positions in the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Mitigation Policies We incorporate several risk mitigation policies into our officer compensation program, including: The Compensation Committees ability to use negative discretion to determine appropriate payouts; Cap on the maximum payouts under our annual cash incentive awards, PBRSRs and PBCAs to limit the potential for excessive risk taking; Anti-hedging and anti-pledging policies; Written clawback policy for financial restatements resulting from executive misconduct; and Written policy on equity grant timing practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain a legacy Retirement Plan (pension plan) and Benefit Restoration Plan (pension restoration plan) for regular full-time employees other than those employees who are covered by plans administered by labor unions and certain other non-exempt employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective December 31, 2007, the pension and pension restoration plans were frozen for all plan participants other than those who were eligible to continue to participate (based on age and tenure) and elected to do so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, for those employees who were not eligible, or did not elect, to continue to participate, benefits ceased accruing under the defined benefit plans after December 31, 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All retirement benefits earned as of December 31, 2007 are fully preserved, continue to be subject to the applicable vesting schedule, and will be paid in accordance with the plans and applicable legal requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No employees hired or rehired after January 1, 2007 are eligible to participate in the pension or pension restoration plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2008, employees who were no longer eligible to continue to earn benefits in the pension plan were automatically transitioned to an enhanced 401(k) plan and a non-elective deferred compensation plan (if eligible) for their retirement benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 401(k) plan provides that employees hired or rehired prior to January 1, 2016 will receive: (1) a Company contribution equal to 3% of eligible pay, subject to a vesting schedule; and (2) a 50% Company match of employee contributions of up to 5% of eligible pay, subject in each case to IRS limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees hired or rehired on or after January 1, 2016 will receive a 50% Company match of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: employee contributions of up to 6% of eligible pay, subject to IRS limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our deferred compensation plan provides for Company contributions in excess of the applicable IRS limitations under the 401(k) plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees eligible for Ryder contribution enhancements in the 401(k) plan are also eligible for the enhancements in the deferred compensation plan provided they meet the eligibility requirements under the deferred compensation plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on their age and tenure with Ryder, Mr. Sanchez, Mr. Garcia, Mr. Fatovic and Mr. Diez did not meet the eligibility requirements to continue accruing benefits under the pension and pension restoration plans, and, as such, their pension benefits were frozen and each is now entitled to the enhanced benefits under the 401(k) plan and deferred compensation plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cooke was hired after January 1, 2007 and, therefore, was not eligible to participate in the pension or pension restoration plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cooke is entitled to the enhanced benefits under the 401(k) plan and deferred compensation plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits payable under the pension plan are based on an employees career earnings with us and our subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the normal retirement age of 65, a participant is entitled to a monthly pension benefit payable for life.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual pension benefit, when paid in the form of a life annuity with no survivors benefits, is generally equal to the sum of 1.45% of the first $15,600 of total compensation received during each calendar year that the employee is eligible to participate in the plan, plus 1.85% of the excess over $15,600.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The only elements of compensation considered in applying the payment and benefits formula are, to the extent applicable: eligible salary, annual cash incentive award, overtime, vacation and commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension plan benefits vest at the earlier of the completion of five years of credited service or upon reaching age 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a participant is over age 55 and has more than ten years of continuous credited service, he or she is eligible to retire with an unreduced benefit at age 62.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a change of control, all participants will be fully vested and the term accrued benefit will include the value of early retirement benefits for any participant age 45 or older or with ten or more years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefits are not subject to any reduction for Social Security benefits or other offset amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An employees pension benefits may be paid in certain alternative forms having actuarially equivalent values.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum annual benefit under a qualified defined benefit pension plan is currently $215,000 beginning at the Social Security retirement age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pension restoration plan covers those pension plan participants whose benefits are reduced by the Internal Revenue Code or other United States laws and are eligible to participate in the pension restoration plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant in the pension restoration plan is entitled to a benefit equaling the difference between the amount of benefits the participant is entitled to receive without the reductions and the amount of benefits the participant is entitled to receive after the reductions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event an NEO voluntarily terminates his employment with us, or is terminated for cause (as defined below), the NEO will not be entitled to receive any severance payments under the terms of his severance agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEO will retain any accrued compensation and benefits to the extent vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of voluntary termination only, all unvested equity awards will be canceled and the NEO will have three months from the date of termination to exercise any vested stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of termination for cause only, all equity awards, vested and unvested, will be canceled.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash and Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of death, the NEOs beneficiaries would receive benefits under the executive life insurance policies we maintain on his behalf, which benefits are equal to three times the NEOs current base salary up to an aggregate of $3.0 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, welfare benefits (health, dental and prescription) are extended for 60 days for covered beneficiaries, the total cost of which would range from approximately $1,960 to $3,266, depending on the NEOs coverage and number of covered family members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of disability, the NEO would be entitled to any amounts paid under our disability insurance policies, including the supplemental long-term disability we maintain for executive officers (as described under Retirement and Welfare Benefits and Perquisites in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon death or disability, the NEO (or his beneficiary) would also be entitled to a pro-rata payment under our annual cash incentive award program.

sentences.text: DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Description of Director Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key objective of the compensation program for our Board is to align the interests of the Board with the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our Board compensation program is designed to attract directors that have the necessary skills, experience and character to fulfill their responsibilities and to enhance long-term value for our shareholders and ensure the continuity and vitality of our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors who are employees receive no compensation or benefits for service on the Board other than the right to participate in our Matching Gifts to Education Program at the Board level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our non-employee directors received the following compensation during 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an annual Board retainer of $65,000, payable in January of each year;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an annual committee retainer of $35,000, payable in May of each year;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an annual grant of $125,000 in restricted stock units (RSUs), made on the date of our Annual Meeting of shareholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a Board or committee meeting attendance fee of $1,000 for each additional Board or committee meeting attended in excess of eight Board meetings or eight committee meetings, payable in December of each year;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a committee chair retainer, payable in May of each year, to the Chairs of the Finance and Governance Committees ($10,000) and to the Chairs of the Audit and Compensation Committees ($15,000); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a Lead Independent Director retainer of $25,000, payable in May of each year, to the Boards Lead Independent Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of RSUs granted is based on the closing sales price of Ryder common stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The RSUs vest following a directors initial year of service on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thereafter, the RSUs will vest immediately upon grant for directors with at least one year of service on the Board and are delivered (either as a lump sum or in annual installments as elected in advance by the director) upon termination of a directors service on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The units receive dividends which are reinvested through our Dividend Reinvestment Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the occurrence of a change of control, as defined in the relevant equity plan, all outstanding RSUs will be delivered to the director in a lump sum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are given the option to receive all or any portion of their annual retainer of $65,000 in Ryder common stock, which cannot be sold until six months following the date such person ceases to be a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our deferred compensation plan, directors have the option of deferring receipt of their annual Board and Committee retainers as well as excess meeting fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not pay above- market or preferential earnings on compensation deferred by the directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are not eligible to participate in our pension plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain a legacy Directors Charitable Awards Program pursuant to which each director elected prior to January 1, 2005 may designate up to two charitable organizations to which we will contribute an aggregate of $500,000 in ten annual installments in the directors name following the directors death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The program is currently funded with the proceeds of insurance policies and the directors obtain no financial benefits from the program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Three of our directors were elected prior to January 1, 2005 and currently participate in the program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors may also participate in our Matching Gifts to Education Program available to all employees, under which we match a directors contributions to eligible educational institutions up to a maximum of $10,000 per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees are limited to a maximum of $1,000 per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Stock Ownership Requirements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To further align the interests of our directors and shareholders, we impose stock ownership requirements on our directors, who are expected to own Ryder common stock or common stock equivalents (including any vested or unvested RSUs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017, the Board increased the stock ownership requirements for directors from five times such director's total annual cash retainer to six times the total annual cash retainer, based on a five-year rolling average stock price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ownership requirements must be proportionately satisfied within five years of the directors election to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, all directors were in compliance with these stock ownership requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADVISORY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (Proposal 3)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are providing shareholders with an advisory vote on executive compensation, or Say on Pay, as required pursuant to the Dodd- Frank Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Say on Pay vote is a non-binding vote on the compensation of our NEOs, as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section, the tabular disclosure regarding such compensation and the accompanying narrative disclosure set forth in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Dodd-Frank Act requires us to hold the Say on Pay vote at least once every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the recommendation of our shareholders at our 2011 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, our Board has chosen to hold the Say on Pay vote every year (and at this year's Annual Meeting, we are providing shareholders with another advisory vote on the frequency with which we hold a Say on Pay vote).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At last years Annual Meeting, we held a Say on Pay vote and approximately 96% of shareholder votes cast supported our executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board supports this resolution because it believes that our executive compensation program reflects the Company's commitment to pay for performance, supports the Company's ability to sustain long-term growth while accounting for sound risk management and aligns the interests of our executives with those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because this resolution relates to the information about executive compensation contained in this proxy statement, beginning with the Compensation Discussion and Analysis on page 29, shareholders should review that information in considering their vote on the resolution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although this Say and Pay vote on executive compensation is non-binding, we highly value input from and engagement with our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the Compensation Committee will review the results of the vote and, consistent with our record of shareholder engagement, take the outcome of the vote into account when determining future executive compensation arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are therefore asked to vote for or against the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the shareholders of Ryder approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of Ryders NEOs, as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section, the tabular disclosure regarding such compensation and the accompanying narrative disclosure set forth in Ryders 2017 Annual Meeting proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote FOR adoption of the resolution approving the compensation of our NEOs, as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section and related tabular and narrative disclosure set forth in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADVISORY VOTE ON FREQUENCY OF THE VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (Proposal 4)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to providing shareholders with the opportunity to cast a Say on Pay vote, we are also providing shareholders with the opportunity to cast a non-binding, advisory vote on whether the advisory vote on executive compensation (Say on Pay) should occur
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: every one, two or three years, commonly referred to as a Say on Frequency resolution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You have the option to vote for any of the three options, or to abstain from casting a vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Dodd-Frank Act requires us to hold this non-binding, advisory vote on the frequency of presenting Say on Pay votes to our shareholders at least once every six years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2011 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, our shareholders voted for, and the Board mplemented, the option of holding an annual Say on Pay vote at each Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders contacted during our 2011 shareholder outreach expressed a preference for an annual Say on Pay vote and this has become the current prevalent market practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that an advisory vote to approve executive compensation every year is appropriate for the Company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SHAREHOLDER PROPOSAL TO PERMIT ACTION BY WRITTEN CONSENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (Proposal 5)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John Chevedden, the beneficial holder of 100 shares of the Company's common stock, has notified Ryder that he intends to present the following nonbinding, advisory proposal at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon oral or written request, the Company will promptly provide address information for the shareholder proponent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposal as submitted reads as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 5 - Right to Act by Written Consent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resolved, Shareholders request that our board of directors undertake such steps as may be necessary to permit written consent by shareholders entitled to cast the minimum number of votes that would be necessary to authorize the action at a meeting at which all shareholders entitled to vote thereon were present and voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This written consent is to be consistent with applicable law and consistent with giving shareholders the fullest power to act by written consent consistent with applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This includes shareholder ability to initiate any topic for written consent consistent with applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal topic won majority shareholder support at 13 major companies in a single year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This included 67% support at both AllState and Sprint.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hundreds of major companies enable shareholder action by written consent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taking action by written consent in lieu of a meeting is a means shareholders can use to raise important matters outside the normal annual meeting cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A shareholder right to act by written consent and to call a special meeting are 2 complimentary ways to bring an important matter to the attention of both management and shareholders outside the annual meeting cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taking action by written consent saves the expense of holding a special shareholder meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please vote to enhance shareholder value:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Right to Act by Written Consent- Proposal 5
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board's Statement in Opposition to Shareholder Proposal
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has given careful consideration to the nonbinding, advisory shareholder proposal seeking to permit shareholders to act by written consent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the actions requested by the proponent are not in the best interests of all of Ryders shareholders and recommends a vote AGAINST this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Proposal is Not in the Best Interests of All Shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Implementation of this proposal could permit fundamental corporate changes to occur outside of a shareholders meeting, without notice to other shareholders or time for thoughtful consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subsets of shareholders with special interests would be able to use a written consent procedure at any time and as frequently as they choose to act on a variety of potentially significant matters without notice to all shareholders and without a meeting or another forum at which all shareholders would have a fair opportunity to discuss the merits of a proposed action and question management and the proponent on the basis for their respective positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such actions disenfranchise smaller shareholders who may not be given a chance to participate through a written consent process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryder System, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement 56
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Proposal to Permit Action by Written Consent (Proposal 5)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Permitting action by written consent may prevent shareholders from receiving accurate and complete information on important pending actions and deny the Board the opportunity to consider the merits of a proposed action and suggest alternatives for shareholder evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, multiple shareholder groups could solicit multiple written consents simultaneously, some of which may be duplicative or contradictory.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryder Shareholders Have the Right to Call a Special Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board understands that some shareholders view the ability to act by written consent to be an important right.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board believes that Ryders By-Law provisions governing the ability to call special meetings, which provide for notice and full disclosure to all shareholders, afford shareholders a more equitable opportunity to raise matters between Annual Meetings than does enabling a limited group of shareholders to act by written consent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the Boards commitment to being held accountable to our shareholders, Ryder's By-Laws permit holders of 10% of the Company's outstanding shares to call a special shareholder meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The low threshold of 10% required to call a special meeting provides even a substantial minority of shareholders the opportunity to raise issues and initiate corporate action, and ensures that notice and a chance to participate in a meeting are given to all shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This 10% threshold also protects against the exertion of undue influence, which could occur with written consent, by individual shareholders with special interests that may be inconsistent with the long-term best interests of all shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryder has a Corporate Governance Structure that Supports Shareholder Rights and Board Accountability
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryder views its relationships with shareholders and other stakeholders as fundamental to its good corporate governance practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryder regularly engages with shareholders representing at least 50% of the Company's outstanding shares on a broad variety of governance issues and, on many occasions, has taken actions to address shareholder concerns and safeguard the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, in 2016, following discussions with shareholders and as part of our annual review of corporate governance practices, Ryder adopted an amendment to the Companys By-Laws allowing proxy access for director nominations by shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the By-Law provisions, a shareholder or group of up to 25 shareholders who own at least 3% of the Companys outstanding common stock continuously for three years may nominate candidates representing the greater of 20% of directors or two Board seats and include those nominees in Ryders proxy materials, provided that the shareholders and nominees satisfy the requirements specified in our By-Laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that Ryders existing corporate governance structure strikes the right balance between affording shareholders the platform to raise important issues and protecting against potentially abusive actions that disrupt effective management of the Company and undermine the interests of all shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote AGAINST this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: statement for the 2017 Annual Meeting, as required in our By-Laws (no earlier than October 21, 2017 and no later than November 20, 2017).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a shareholder would like to nominate one or more directors for election at the 2018 Annual Meeting outside of the proxy access process (and without using Ryder's proxy materials), he or she must give advance written notice to us at least 90, but no more than 120, days before the one-year anniversary of the 2017 Annual Meeting (no earlier than January 5, 2018 and no later than February 4, 2018), as required by our By-Laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In either case, the notice must include information regarding both the proposing shareholder and the director nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a discussion of the types of information that must be provided, please refer to the discussion under Board Succession Process for Directors beginning on page 20 of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the director nominee must submit a completed and signed questionnaire.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This questionnaire will be provided by the Corporate Secretary upon request and is similar to the annual questionnaire completed by all of our directors relating to their background, experience and independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the requirements relating to the submission of shareholder proposals or director nominations are included in our By-Laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of our By-Laws can be obtained from our Corporate Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The By-Laws are also included in our filings with the SEC which are available on the SECs website at www.sec.gov.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Electronic Delivery
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This year, we have again elected to take advantage of the SECs rule that allows us to furnish proxy materials to you online.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe electronic delivery expedites shareholders receipt of materials, while lowering costs and reducing the environmental impact of our Annual Meeting by reducing printing and mailing of full sets of materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On March 20, 2017, we mailed to our shareholders the Notice regarding Internet availability of proxy materials containing instructions on how to access our proxy statement, annual report and shareholder letter online.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received the Notice by mail, you will not receive a printed copy of the proxy materials, unless you specifically request one.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice contains instructions on how to request a paper copy of the materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most shareholders will receive the proxy statement online.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a paper copy, you can also view these documents on the Internet by accessing the Investors area of our website at http://investors.ryder.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareholder of record you may, if you wish, receive future proxy statements, annual reports and any other accompanying materials electronically.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you vote via the Internet as described on your proxy card, you may sign up for electronic delivery at the same time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also register for electronic delivery of future proxy materials in the Investors area of our website at http://investors.ryder.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you elect this feature, you will receive an e-mail message notifying you when the materials are available along with a web address for viewing the materials and instructions for voting by telephone or on the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to sign up for electronic delivery of future proxy materials as this will allow you to receive the materials more quickly and will reduce printing and mailing costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Householding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are only sending one set of Notices regarding the Internet availability of proxy materials or set of 2017 Annual Meeting materials to shareholders who share the same last name and address, unless they have notified us that they want to continue receiving multiple packages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This practice, known as householding, is intended to eliminate duplicate mailings, conserve natural resources and help reduce printing and mailing costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a record shareholder and you want to request a separate copy of this proxy statement or accompanying 2016 annual report on Form 10-K as filed with the SEC (such report is available free of charge and includes the financial statements and schedules thereto, but not the exhibits) and shareholder letter, you may contact our Investor Relations Department by calling (305) 500-4053, in writing to Ryder System, Inc., Investor Relations Department, 11690 N.W. 105th Street, Miami, Florida 33178 or by e-mail to RyderforInvestors@ryder.com, and a copy will be promptly sent to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to receive separate documents in future mailings, please contact Broadridge by calling (866) 540-7095 or in writing at Broadridge, Householding Department, 51 Mercedes Way, Edgewood, NY 11717.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 annual report, the shareholder letter and this proxy statement are also available through the Investor Relations area of our website at http://investors.ryder.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of any exhibit to the 2016 annual report on Form 10-K will be forwarded following receipt of a written request for such materials addressed to our Investor Relations Department.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Two or more shareholders sharing an address can request delivery of a single copy of the 2017 Annual Meeting materials if they are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: receiving multiple copies by contacting Broadridge in the manner set forth above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a nominee holds your shares, please contact such holder directly to inquire about the possibility of householding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appendix A - Director Independence Standards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryders Director Independence Standards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each relationship described below will not, by itself, be deemed to create a material relationship with the Company for the purpose of determining the directors independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior Employment of Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director was employed by Ryder or was personally working on Ryders audit as an employee or partner of Ryders independent auditor, and over five years have passed since such employment, partner or auditing relationship ended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment of Immediate Family Member.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) an immediate family member was an officer of Ryder or was personally working on Ryders audit as an employee or partner of Ryders independent auditor, and over five years have passed since such employment, partner or auditing relationship ended; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) an immediate family member is currently employed by Ryder in a non-officer position, or by Ryders independent auditor not as a partner and not participating in the firms audit, assurance or tax compliance practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Interlocking Directorships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An executive officer of Ryder served on the board of directors of a company that employed the director or employed an immediate family member as an executive officer, and over five years have passed since either such relationship ended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Commercial Relationships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director is an employee (or a directors immediate family member is an executive officer) of a company that makes or has made payments to, or receives or has received payments (other than contributions, if the company is a tax-exempt organization) from, Ryder for property or services, and the amount of such payments has not within any of such other companys three most recently completed fiscal years exceeded one percent (or $1 million, whichever is greater) of such other companys consolidated gross revenues for such year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Indebtedness Relationships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director or an immediate family member is a partner, greater than 10% shareholder, director or officer of a company that is indebted to Ryder or to which Ryder is indebted, and the aggregate amount of such debt is less than one percent (or $1 million, whichever is greater) of the total consolidated assets of the indebted company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Charitable Relationships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director is a trustee, fiduciary, director or officer of a tax-exempt organization to which Ryder contributes, and the contributions to such organization by Ryder have not within any of such organizations three most recently completed fiscal years exceeded one percent (or $250,000, whichever is greater) of such organizations consolidated gross revenues for such year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All reference to Ryder shall refer to Ryder System, Inc. and all subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An immediate family member includes a directors spouse, parents, children, siblings, mother- and father-in-law, sons- and daughters-in-law, brothers- and sisters-in-law, and anyone (other than domestic employees) who shares such directors home.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
